comments.author: Nate
comments.body:
This may have the snazziest editing yet.

Justin has gone to the Michael Bay school of editing.

comments.author: Caleb
comments.body:
Hahahaha. BURN!!! Try Steven Sprung school of editing!

I think once you get about 15-20 episodes you should make a DVD and sell it in the Moxie. People might even buy it.

But seriously though, "Springfoam" is a better place because of MoxieTV.

comments.author: brian of moore
comments.body:
that was freakishly beautiful...

nice arrested development impressions btw....

i really want to see the movies playing this week
including the beastie boys one i missed
ive been animating (modeling/texturing) nonstop for a week and a half... and will most likely continue to do so for another 2 weeks..
hopefully i can build a time machine soon.. and go back and catch all the movies ive missed...

comments.author: Nate
comments.body:
No, no. I really loved it.
Justin's just playing around with his camera and being arch. This makes it cool.
Michael Bay is a douchebag because he MEANS it.

comments.author: erin
comments.body:
perhaps my favorite?

they are all my favorite.

comments.author: Caleb
comments.body:
Gosh, I can't believe they killed Locke on tonight's episode of Lost...

...just kidding. I'm so evil.

comments.author: Fyse
comments.body: Great stuff guys. Love the ending.

comments.author: nathan springer
comments.body: oh poop ill mitch is amazing i am glad other people know about this guy

comments.author: Maddy
comments.body:
I had a dream last night that I got a job at the Moxie. All was wonderful until Dan and Nicole started hiding fugitives. (And they weren't even fun fugitives--they were, like, cracked out scary women.)

Needless to say, I woke up before I got fired, but I think that was were I was heading.

comments.author: brian of moore
comments.body:
those cute girls at the show last night.. spoke to us...
they were cute
